intro: Lasiosiphon metzianus, commonly known as the New Zealand mistflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
